 I know this is a late reaction and I hope you get back to see this but believe it or not this is a huge topic at the NCAA. I'm the president of a student/athlete group called SAAC or Student Athlete Advisory Committee here at my school. The Committee is here to support student athletes, to fundraise for athletic functions, perform community services and lastly to make the life here at our school. But anyways I was selected to attend the NCAA National Leadership Conference this past summer done in Orlando. At the conference we would talk about different issues that arise on campuses and one of them was paying college athletes. The concerns about paying college athletes were, finances-large, medium, small institutions can not afford to pay they're student/athletes do to the fact there is an AVERAGE of 200+ student/athletes at each institution. Secondly it ruins the amatuer notion of intercollegiate athletics. And the last big concern is the fans. Fans of the institutions would be watching a mini NBA, NFL, MLS, MLB, etc. So to react to your statement of us not being able to do anything, there really is, and I'm a part of it.
 
 (last little note: believe it or not there were many athletes at the conference, DI, DII, and DIII who were very much opposed to the idea.)
